column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Best art museum I have ever been to -- more navigable and consolidated than the MET & Getty
column2: bigger and more diverse than the MFA.  Incredible
column3: emotionally stimulating collection of 19th century American landscape paintings (New England and West-- George Inness
column6: Martin Heade) and East Asian ceramics.  Famous paintings include Edward Hopper's "Nighthawks" and Grant Wood's "American Gothic" (the farmers).  The only thing lacking in my opinion was Roman sculptures.  But wow
column7: I've never left a museum feeling so awakened
